moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6: A classic opening - the Queen's Gambit Declined. White usually continues with Nc3.
moves.3. Nf3 b6 4. Bf4: I think you should have anticipated Black's next move and played either cxd5 or e3.
moves.4... Ba6 5. c5: This loses a pawn without any compensation. You could have played either the simple 5.cxd5 or 5.e3 dxc4 6.Bxc4 Bxc4 7.Qa4  winning back the bishop.
moves.5... bxc5 6. dxc5 Bxc5 7. Qa4+ Qd7 8. Qx: 8...Kxd7 would have given Black the advantage. With the queens off the board the king would be in a strong position on d7.
moves.9. Bxc7 Rc8 10. Ba5: Bg3 would have been better, in order to maintain control over the important square e5.
moves.10... Ngf6 11. g3: Too slow. You should have anticipated what was coming and played Nc3. The general rule says "knights before bishops".
moves.11... Ne4 12. e3 Bb4+: I think White could have resigned here!
